name: titularly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If someone holds a position titularly, they have the title of that position without having any responsibilities, duties, or power: She was titularly responsible for the botany department. After her retirement, she remained a professor in Pittsburgh and titularly in Cardiff and London.
in a way that exists in name only: The republic consists of a patchwork of titularly autonomous regions. At that time, Hawaii was titularly an independent kingdom, but it was actually run by the United States.
More examplesFewer examplesThe National Institute for Science was still titularly his employer.The vast fishing and hunting grounds on the islands were titularly owned by a single individual.
